name: Diploma in Additional Needs
description:
Neurodevelopmental Disorders
This is a modern term for a subset of developmental disorders caused by a disruption in the development of the brain. All neurodevelopmental disorders are developmental disorders, but not all developmental disorders are necessarily neurodevelopmental. A vision impairment caused by a physical problem with the eye is a developmental disorder but it is not a neurodevelopmental disorder in the same way that ADHD or Autism are.
In recent years, the term neurodevelopmental disorders has become widely used in fields like psychiatry and paediatrics, as it points to the underlying neurological basis of conditions like autism and ADHD.

name: Neurodevelopmental Disorders
description: This broad, overarching term relates to conditions that begin during the developmental periodâ€”typically in childhood. These conditions may cause significant limitations in a person's physical, learning, language, or behavioural abilities. It includes some physical disabilities or sensory impairments.
